P000309.project_abstract: The Basic Education Sector Project will support the education ten year program, within this first phase which will lay the foundation for accelerating the development of basic education, ensuring adequate quality, and financial sustainability. Its main components will: 1) improve access to basic education, by increasing the primary school enrollment ratio to 56 percent by the year 2005, equalizing educational opportunities, and supporting reforms to improve education. Construction, and rehabilitation of primary schools will be financed, as will the provision of teaching materials, teacher training, and micro-nutrients, in an effort to encourage girl's enrollment through information campaigns, in support of mother's associations, and the establishment of a peer tutoring program. Adult literacy programs will cover structured learning activities, and training/workshops will be funded to strengthen provider capacity; 2) improve the quality of basic education, by supporting the Government's educational reforms, through the revision of pre- and in-service training programs. A new curriculum will be developed in compliance with the primary education reform, while provision of pedagogical materials will be available in the form of textbooks, and educational tools, to be based on quality initiatives, and evaluation of learning outcomes, in addition to the development of early childhood activities; and, 3) improve management, and capacity building within the Ministry of Education, to be supported by organization, and methods studies. Systems development, and training will be funded, to upgrade material resources, and unit-based capacity building operations.

P000527.project_abstract: The main objective of the Chad Education Sector Reform Project (PARSET) is to develop the policy framework, strategies, and means for quality universal basic education and to implement corresponding activities. The focus will be on building the institutional capcity for a more effective partnership between the State and the communities, and more equitable access to education. The project seeks also to develop the technical capacity necessary for overall curriculum and pedagogic renewal in Chadian schools, by launching several innovative programs aimed at both expanding access to education and improving the quality of teaching and learning. There are four project components, each of which comprises several sub-components. In particular, the project seeks to: a) promote gender and geographic equity by supporting the Government's strategy to share education sector management with communities; b) develop a community-based approach to rehabilitiate existing school infrastructure; c) improve the quality of the teaching and learning environment; d) develop innovative programs for literacy, non-formal education, early childhood development, bilingual education, interactive radio instruction, and school health and nutrition; e) enhance program planning, management, and monitoring capacity; and f) builds concensus and convince diverse actors of the benefits of higher education and vocational and technical education reforms. In addition, the project will contribute to strengthen planning, management, and program monitoring, as well as reinforce coordination and establish an effective collaboration process between the Government and donors.
